item.title: Python Beginner Projects 2020 - Add them to your resume!
item.description:
Learning Python? You should consider building some projects! They truly help you understand how all the snippets of code work together. However, you always see the same projects around and recruiters are not too excited to see always the same stuff. Be creative! In this video, I show you three projects examples that you can use to set yourself apart from the competition!
Corona Invaders: https://github.com/DavideMerlin/Corona_Invaders Election Scraper: https://github.com/DavideMerlin/Twitter_election_scraper Login Automation: https://github.com/DavideMerlin/Automated_login
TIMESTAMPS: 00:00 Intro 00:52 General Advice 1:29 Project 1: Corona Invader 2:55 Project 2: Election Scraper 4:31 Project 3: Login Automation 5:58 Conclusions
#Python #Projects
Social:
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/davidemerlin97
item.author: (Davide Merlin)

item.title: Let's Talk about Cache - Daniel Leskosky
item.description: A cache is hardware or software that is used to temporarily store data. Learn about when caches are used and how caching works.
item.author: (About Daniel Leskosky)

item.title: Create change within your locus of control
item.description: When you want to change policy, show, don‚Äôt tell. Start by creating the change within your local environment, demonstrating the benefits, and encouraging others to try it. Once you‚Äôve proven out the playbook and earned enthusiastic support, then advocate for a formal policy change.

item.title: The Problem of Preference Falsification in Online Dating
item.description: Online dating is as old as the internet. It has exploded in popularity in recent years: roughly 40% of straight couples now meet online. It has given women more safety and choice as they participate in the dating market, and brought down divorce rates as people date more widely and make better-informed decisions than in the past.

item.title: Who Should Buy ARM? - Dr. Z and Eng. L
item.description: There are rumors about NVIDIA in advanced talks of buying ARM. Softbank has been in need of cash injection for some time, and ARM itself is a good asset.

item.title: Tines Blog / Part 1 : Breaches are inevitable and early detection is crucial
item.description: This is part 1 of a 3 part series on security automation for dealing with account compromise. Part 1 covers detection, part 2 looks at enrichment and case management, while part 3 tackles protection and response including prompting the user to acknowledge the incident via a side-channel.

item.title: Cosmetics firm Avon leaks 19 million customer records (Includes interview)
item.description: The latest data breach has struck the purveyor of lower-cost cosmetics - Avon. Once a staple of door-to-door selling, the company has operated a successful online business for many years.

item.title: Hacking Portable Air Conditioners
item.description: I bought a couple EdgeStar AP14001HS portable air conditioners in April 2020, since I expect to spend most of the Summer at home. I'm not able to use window A/Cs here, though that would be the obvious choice for efficiency because all the hot parts remain outside.

item.title: NASA Astronauts Return Home in SpaceX's Crew Dragon Spacecraft
item.description:
They‚Äôre coming home! üåé
On Aug. 1, NASA astronauts Robert Behnken and Douglas Hurley will depart from the International Space Station aboard SpaceX‚Äôs Dragon ‚ÄúEndeavour‚Äù spacecraft after their mission aboard our orbiting laboratory. Starting at 5:15 p.m. EDT, tune in for our live coverage to see the duo undock from the station and make their return back to planet Earth.
item.author: (NASA)
